update.description:
The motivation is that [Display Plugins](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/issues/31) can attach all of their custom visuals to a single visual, for which the visibility is then toggled on and off. You can imagine the TF display in RViz as an extreme case: without something like this, that plugin has to keep track of all of its custom visuals and iterate through them when the display is enabled/disabled. With this PR, toggling of visibility is handled in the [base class](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/src/e055a5a0b3a228b023775a729a28120b67d24608/src/DisplayPlugin.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#DisplayPlugin.cc-188), and subclasses don’t have to worry about it.

I implemented this copying `SetInheritScale`. I didn't add `Visible()` getter like there is an `InheritScale()` because AFAIK Ogre [doesn’t support it](https://forums.ogre3d.org/viewtopic.php?t=67348).

What is potentially an issue with this PR is that I didn’t find a similar notion for toggling visibility for Optix Groups. I am not sure how we want to proceed when it’s not just that it isn’t *currently *implemented for Optix, it might be that, for fundamental reasons, it won’t *ever* be implemented?

‌
update.title: Add SetVisible for Visual

content.raw:
thanks I simplified some changes in [fdfefd7](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/fdfefd7fe6cc62b2b77b6587733f21e03445d173).

[pull request #71](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/71/revert-a-change-in-visual-to-fix-text/diff) should hopefully fix the Text Geometry issue 

this PR looks good to me
content.html:
thanks I simplified some changes in fdfefd7.

pull request #71 should hopefully fix the Text Geometry issue

this PR looks good to me

update.title: Add SetVisible for Visual

content.raw:
thanks, wasn’t sure if conceptually this will ever have an equivalent in Optix, but I’ve added it to BaseVisual as requested in [0403ca4](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/0403ca4ea41f6eda5863b03a83c559ea2730cc20?at=default)

FWIU, keeping track of a visual’s visibility with a variable wouldn’t be trivial since a Visual might be set to invisible as a side effect of its parent being set to invisible, so I support leaving potential implementation of that out of this PR

I was avoiding merging with default during my hand-testing so as not to pull in [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/issues/25/](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/issues/25/) but have merged now which hopefully will address the pipeline failure
content.html:
thanks, wasn’t sure if conceptually this will ever have an equivalent in Optix, but I’ve added it to BaseVisual as requested in 0403ca4

FWIU, keeping track of a visual’s visibility with a variable wouldn’t be trivial since a Visual might be set to invisible as a side effect of its parent being set to invisible, so I support leaving potential implementation of that out of this PR

I was avoiding merging with default during my hand-testing so as not to pull in #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/issues/25/ but have merged now which hopefully will address the pipeline failure

update.title: Add SetVisible for Visual

content.raw:
This looks good to me. In the past we had done something like using a member variable to keep track of a particular visual’s visibility since ogre doesn’t support it. But I don’t think we need to worry about that for now.

pipelines and jenkins builds are failing. This branch probably needs to be merged with default.

Support for optix is currently on hold. I think you could just add a `SetVisible` function in `BaseVisual` class and print out an error like [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/src/09d6735be4d543452ba0d2e007b6782f775d0beb/include/ignition/rendering/base/BaseCamera.hh#lines-428) to let the user know that it’s not supported yet.

‌
content.html:
This looks good to me. In the past we had done something like using a member variable to keep track of a particular visual’s visibility since ogre doesn’t support it. But I don’t think we need to worry about that for now.

pipelines and jenkins builds are failing. This branch probably needs to be merged with default.

Support for optix is currently on hold. I think you could just add a SetVisible function in BaseVisual class and print out an error like here to let the user know that it’s not supported yet.

‌
